Body: Description: Lost console access to Endpoint Protector server after setting FQDN in Server Certificate Stack per https://www.endpointprotector.com/support/endpoint-protector/how-to-set-fqdn-in-subject - not able to SSH using root either. Cannot open console by IP or FQDN - connection refused. This is not in production yet

What We've Learned Updated: the customer set server certificate stack and regenerated the certificate. the action caused a loss of access to the console.
the IP change did not regenerate the certificate to default, so I reached out to devops.
Next Steps Updated: will send steps or set up a remote session tomorrow after I receive steps from devops

What We've Learned Updated: 1 May '25 - the customer set server certificate stack and regenerated the certificate. the action caused a loss of access to the console.
the IP change did not regenerate the certificate to default, so I reached out to devops.

2 May '25 - devops did not provide a solution, but in my tests I managed to restore a backup, but it was not needed anymore since the customer has a snapshot and will revert
Next Steps Updated: waiting for the customer to restore the appliance and then help him set up what he needs regarding certs next week
